reviewText: You know... LIFE used to be SO simple... I just wrote a wonderful review that NO ONE will ever read because ofarthritic fingers that just, now, dragged across the WRONG button on this "hp" thing-a-ma-bob and deleted whatI WANTED to say. Here we go again....My nieces grew up on this R.L. Stine Goosebumps/Haunting Hour stuff. THEY out-grew it; I didn't. I have all ofTHIS stuff, and all of the "adult" stuff like WAREHOUSE 13; SUPERNATURAL; and, of course, THE WALKING DEAD.If it's supernaturally haunting with the walking dead.... I warehouse it in MY man cave!_____________________________________________________________________________________________Well, that was MOST of it, but at 64, I find I can re-visit these stories and remember just enough...to keep each re-experience interesting.Highly recommended... for the entire family; really!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been a huge fan of R.L Stine's work since I was a little kid. I remember going to the library book fair every year at school & the only books I would buy were the Goosebumps books. I still have them & I still read them from time to time. I also used to love the old Goosebumps show & I have a few of them on dvd. When I came across "The Haunting Hour" I just had to buy it! I never watched the show before because I don't have cable/satellite, but I knew it would be a good show & it was/is! I really hope they continue making more of these episodes. I enjoy watching them, I have always loved scary/spooky shows like this. My favorite episodes on this one are "Wrong Number" & "Lights Out"... these two were extra creepy.

reviewText: Often similar to tone and theme to R.L. Stine’s famed mid-1990s series, GOOSEBUMPS, THE HAUNTING HOUR: THE SERIES is darker in both tone and content and the production values are usually notches above those of GOOSEBUMPS. The show is like a more mature version of GOOSEBUMPS. THE HAUNTING HOUR VOLUME 4 contains five episodes from the series. Each episode is about 22 minutes in length, including the show intro and the credits. The episodes in this volume all have a theme to them: knowing who you are. The episodes are:“Wrong Number” – Steffani (Debby Ryan) and Taylor (Sarah Dugdale) are their school’s mean girls. They enjoy making friend of the Goth-looking Adriana (Kacey Rohl) and making prank calls to the old woman who lives next door in Steffani’s apartment. The old woman, Mrs. Biazevich (Karin Konoval) warns the girls to be nice girls and dies the next day. Steffani starts getting text messages from someone who sounds like Mrs. Biazevich. The old woman can’t be sending messages from beyond the grave or can she?“Afraid of Clowns” – Chris (Jake Cherry) has been afraid of clowns all his life. He has nightmares about them and just before his 13th birthday, he realizes that he’s being stalked by them. To overcome his fears, he attends a special “Calvalcade of Clowns” that’s in town with a girl he really likes. The more Chris sees of the place, the more queasy it makes him become and he gets the distinct feeling that the whole amusement park & show are just for him.“Pool Shark”- Kai (Booboo Steward) works at an indoor pool where some Olympic athletes train. Although he can swim, Kai is scared to death of the water since seeing a shark in the water when he was a boy. One day while at the pool, Kai is convinced he sees a shark in the indoor pool, but no one believes him. Is Kai crazy or has the legendary Nanaue from Hawaii followed him here?“Lights Out” – Teddy (Gabriel Basso) doesn’t believe in ghosts and after watching a ghost show with some friends, is convinced they are all fake and that they can make their own ghost-hunting show. Later, he, his sister, and best friend travel to a closed mental hospital at night to film their own ghost-hunting tv show. As Teddy soon discovers, there really are ghosts in this place and all they seem to be worried about is “lights out.”“The Perfect Brother”- Josh loves his brother Matt. Matt is the perfect son and Josh thinks his parents are too harsh to Matt when he begins not to excel as well in school. After overhearing a conversation with his parents, Josh believes that his parents are going to have Matt undergo a serious operation to correct his “failures” and he’s determined to not let that happen.It's quite easy to watch R.L. STINE'S THE HAUNTING HOUR: THE SERIES, VOL. 3. The acting isn’t bad for a half-hour tv show aimed at older children. However, this is still a lower budget tv show, so the shows do tend to skimp a little on expensive props, plenty of extra actors, and fancy sets.Personally, I found liked all of the episodes on THE HAUNTING HOUR: THE SERIES VOL. 4 except for “Afraid of Clowns.” That episode really isn’t frightening, haunting, scary, or thrilling, but is instead just plain bizarre.The extras on the DVD are some original promos and a "Behind the Screams" of a few of the episodes.
Title: N/A
